wiki.content: "Lovesick Girls" is a song recorded by BLACKPINK. It was released on October 2, 2020, as the third single off of the group's first Korean-language studio album, THE ALBUM. Members Jisoo and Jennie are credited with writing the song. "Lovesick Girls" is a dance-pop and electropop track with elements of country, folk and EDM sound. Lyrically, the song deals with the pain after a heartbreak. An accompanying music video for the song was directed by Seo Hyun-seung and uploaded onto BLACKPINK's YouTube channel simultaneously with the single's release. It garnered 61.4 million views in its first 24 hours, becoming the sixth biggest 24-hour debut for a music video. The song peaked at number 2 in South Korea. It also charted on Billboard charts, including peaked number 59 on Hot 100, peaked number two on Global 200 and number one on Global Excl. U.S. The song also charted in several territories, including Australia, Canada, France, Hungary, Japan, Ireland, Malaysia, New Zealand, Portugal, Scotland, Singapore, Slovakia and the United Kingdom. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
